IF YOU'RE ARE EECS (And your company has a relationship with the department (i.e. tech talks, eecs career fair, interviews in Soda etc): For all offers extended for full-time employment or summer internships (including return offers), employers should allow until November 1 or a minimum of two weeks from the date of the written offer, whichever is later, for students to accept or decline any offer.

IF YOU'RE L&S CS or your company recruits via the career center (i.e. career fairs, on-campus interviews, etc): For all offers extended for summer internships or full-time employment, including return offers, employers should allow a minimum of three weeks from the date of the written offer for students to accept or decline. (There is an exception for the big 4 accounting firms)

Some big companies have attempted to ignore/skirt these rules before, but having a relationship with the department/school end up extremely important and the companies almost always back down due to the consequences of breaking the rules.

Normally, these companies have some sort of internal deadline for return offer acceptances, and that should be conveyed to you at the end of your internship. In my experience, this deadline usually is between mid-October and early November, so my guess is that it should be around there.

Any suggestions/experiences?
